How to Visit a Doctor in Austria as an International Student üè•üá¶üáπ

Published: Mar 6, 2025 |  at  05:06 AM
| Suggest Changes

If you are a student in Austria, you will need health insurance to visit a doctor for free or at a reduced cost. Here‚Äôs a complete guide on how to find a doctor, use your health insurance, and get medical treatment.

‚úÖ What Type of Health Insurance Do Students Need?

üìå International students in Austria must have valid health insurance to access medical care.
You can use:

‚úîÔ∏è √ñGK (Austrian Public Insurance) ‚Äì Most common student insurance
‚úîÔ∏è Private Insurance ‚Äì UNIQA, Care Concept, Feelsafe, etc.
‚úîÔ∏è EU Health Insurance Card (EHIC) ‚Äì If you are from the EU/EEA

üí° If you are working part-time in Austria, your employer may provide √ñGK insurance.

üìå How to Find a Doctor in Austria?

1Ô∏è‚É£ Search for a Doctor Near You

üîé Use these websites to find doctors in your area:

üîó Doctor Search ‚Äì √ñsterreichische Gesundheitskasse (√ñGK)
üîó Arztsuche (Doctor Finder) ‚Äì √Ñrztekammer

üí° Tip: Use the filter ‚ÄúSprache‚Äù (Language) ‚Üí English to find English-speaking doctors.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Check if the Doctor Accepts Your Insurance

  • If you have √ñGK insurance, look for ‚ÄúAlle Kassen‚Äù (Accepts public insurance).
  • If you have private insurance, you may need to pay first and request reimbursement.
  • For private doctors, check their website for pricing (they usually charge ‚Ç¨50‚Äì‚Ç¨120 per visit).

3Ô∏è‚É£ First Doctor Registration & House Doctor Rule

‚úîÔ∏è The first general doctor (Hausarzt) you visit will automatically be assigned as your primary doctor.
‚úîÔ∏è You can change your house doctor after 3 months if needed.
‚úîÔ∏è To change your doctor, you must register with a new doctor and inform √ñGK or your insurance provider.

üí° Tip: Choose a doctor carefully since you will be assigned to them for at least 3 months!

4Ô∏è‚É£ Make an Appointment

üìû Call the doctor‚Äôs office or book online via:

  • Doctena ‚Üí www.doctena.at
  • Arztsuche ‚Üí www.arztnoe.at

üí° Tip: General practitioners (Hausarzt) don‚Äôt always require an appointment. Walk-ins may be possible.

üö® Emergency Medical Help (If You Need Urgent Care)

If you need urgent medical attention, go to:

üìç Emergency Rooms & Hospitals

‚úîÔ∏è AKH Wien (Vienna General Hospital) ‚Äì www.akhwien.at
‚úîÔ∏è SMZ Ost ‚Äì Donauspital (Hospital in Vienna 22)

üöë Emergency Hotline Numbers:
üìû 144 ‚Äì Ambulance (Rettung)
üìû 141 ‚Äì Emergency Doctor (Notarzt)
üìû 112 ‚Äì General EU Emergency Number

üí° Tip: If it‚Äôs not an emergency but you need medical advice, call 1450 (Health Hotline).

üíä How to Get Prescription Medicine in Austria?

  • Doctors will give you a prescription (Rezept) after your visit.
  • You can buy medicine at any Apotheke (Pharmacy).
  • Pharmacies have emergency services at night and on weekends.

üìå Find the nearest open pharmacy here: Apotheken Notdienst

üí∞ How Much Does a Doctor Visit Cost?

Type of VisitCost with √ñGK InsuranceCost Without Insurance
General Doctor (Hausarzt)Free‚Ç¨50 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨120
Specialist Visit (Dermatologist, ENT, etc.)Free (if referred)‚Ç¨80 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨200
Emergency Hospital VisitFree‚Ç¨200 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨500
Private DoctorNot covered‚Ç¨100 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨300

üí° Tip: If you visit a private doctor, ask for an ‚ÄúHonorarnote‚Äù (invoice) to claim reimbursement from your insurance.

üì¢ Final Tips for Students

‚úîÔ∏è Always carry your E-Card (√ñGK) or insurance document.
‚úîÔ∏è Check if the doctor accepts your insurance before visiting.
‚úîÔ∏è For minor health issues, pharmacies can provide basic medication.
‚úîÔ∏è For urgent care, call 1450 for medical advice.

üì¢ Need More Help?
üìû √ñGK Support: +43 5 0766 112200
üìç Find a Doctor: www.gesundheitskasse.at
üì¢ Join Our WhatsApp Group for student healthcare tips!

üîó Final Summary: How to Visit a Doctor in Austria

‚úîÔ∏è Get health insurance (√ñGK, private, or EHIC).
‚úîÔ∏è Find a doctor online & check if they accept your insurance.
‚úîÔ∏è Your first doctor visit will register them as your house doctor.
‚úîÔ∏è You can change your doctor after 3 months.
‚úîÔ∏è Use 144 for medical emergencies & 1450 for advice.

üéâ Now You Know How to Visit a Doctor in Austria!
With the right insurance and information, getting medical help is easy and stress-free. üöÄ
